greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of numbers with the same prime signature and set of distinct prime factors as n (including n).
comment: The number of permutations of the exponents in the prime signature of n.
The number of terms in the n-th row of A111470.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..75600
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: a(n) = 1 if and only if n is a power of a squarefree number (A072774).
example: a(12) = a(18) = 2 since 12 = 2^2 * 3 and 18 = 3^2 * 2 have the same prime signature, (2, 1), and the same set of distinct prime factors, {2, 3}.
a(60) = a(90) = a(150) = 3 since 60 = 2^2 * 3 * 5, 90 = 3^2 * 2 * 5, and 150 = 5^2 * 2 * 3 have the same prime signature, (2, 1, 1), and the same set of distinct prime factors, {2, 3, 5}.
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 22 2019
